intro: Chaenactis carphoclinia var. peirsonii, commonly known as the Peirson's brittlestem, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and ray florets. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. It has a low, sprawling growth habit with hairy stems and small, blue to purple flowers. Its botanical features make it well adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions.
